children.subject: This is an incredibly vague question that is impossible to answer without knowing anything about you or your motivations.

If you are doing it for:

1. More Money? No

2. Prestige/Feeling Better and More Accomplished? No

3. Learn a topic like ML? Sure, but there are other, cheaper ways

4. Field expects a masters? Best reason to do a masters.

But for some people, these are valid reasons to do it. I doubt you'll get significantly more money anyways, and there will be people who don't care you have a masters.

I have no ambitions for a masters, and it has made undergrad here really stressless. I get great grades i'm happy about, I spend lots of time studying, I learn a ton, but if I see a random question on a test and don't do well on it, or I happen to make a mistake in a calculation, I couldn't care less. My grades don't matter and never will anymore, so i'm having an absolute blast just focusing on learning, growing, and having fun.

history.subject: Worth it to get Masters (Computer Science or DS)?

history.content:
Data Science major, I've had Data Science and Software internships at Capital One and Tesla respectively (Not those exact companies but similar "prestige". Don't want to give too much personal info away). I've gone through a ton of data science rounds, made it to Amazon for their onsite but got rejected, made it to Facebook for their onsite but got rejected, and ultimately have zero offers. I'm better at going farther in DS interview process than CS, but there are a lot less data science jobs than software jobs. Currently feeling pretty discouraged.

Would it be worth for me to get a Masters in either CS or Data Science? My GPA sucks (I have a 3.0. Some of it was major health issues, some of it was my fault). Specifically I got A- in Data 8, B in Data 100, B+ in Stat 158, A- in Ind Eng ML, C in a different Ind Eng ML class, NP in CS 186, P in CS 70, C in CS 88. 

 Thinking of Georgia Tech or UIUC because of the cost and decent reputation, plus they are online. Don't think I would be able to get into anywhere "elite" because of my GPA. Any other options or suggestions you have for someone in my position?
